intro: [WRONG START] Codia lacerata, commonly known as the lacerate cordia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a small to medium-sized tree or shrub that typically grows in coastal areas and dry forests. The plant produces showy, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a rough or hairy texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
